channel.title: defjaf tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from defjaf.

item.description: @WKCosmo And yet truth and popularity are remarkably well correlated.
item.source:markdown: @WKCosmo And yet truth and popularity are remarkably well correlated.

item.description: Two minutes to curtain up at Jerusalem with Mark Rylance at the Apollo Theatre. https://t.co/QCJcnNCguc
item.source:markdown: Two minutes to curtain up at Jerusalem with Mark Rylance at the Apollo Theatre. https://t.co/QCJcnNCguc

item.description: Off to my first in-person scientific meeting in 2 1/2 years — and my first flight without my family in about 7 years. @SimonsObs here I come! https://t.co/knOosfKCEC
item.source:markdown: Off to my first in-person scientific meeting in 2 1/2 years — and my first flight without my family in about 7 years. @SimonsObs here I come! https://t.co/knOosfKCEC

item.description: @atpfm A “golden age” and a “gilded age” are very different (and only one is good, unless you’re a robber-baron).
item.source:markdown: @atpfm A “golden age” and a “gilded age” are very different (and only one is good, unless you’re a robber-baron).

item.description:
@skdh @WKCosmo The decoherence-is-enough response would be that it is converted into a classically indeterminate state — I.e., it really is up or down, you just don’t know which. (nb. I don’t really buy this and may be mischaracterising it.)
@skdh @WKCosmo I guess you then need an epistemic/Bayesian updating step to non-mysteriously convert (not “collapse”) your description of the state to the actual observed case.
item.source:markdown:
@skdh @WKCosmo The decoherence-is-enough response would be that it is converted into a classically indeterminate state — I.e., it really is up or down, you just don’t know which. (nb. I don’t really buy this and may be mischaracterising it.)
@skdh @WKCosmo I guess you then need an epistemic/Bayesian updating step to non-mysteriously convert (not “collapse”) your description of the state to the actual observed case.
